intro: Phyllostegia glandulosa, commonly known as the stickyleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
